title: Electron and proton kinetic energy between plates

content.prompt: A proton p and an electron e are released simultaneously on opposite sides of an evacuated area between large, charged parallel plates, as shown above. Each particle is accelerated toward the oppositely charged plate. The particles are far enough apart so that they do not affect each other. Which particle has the greater kinetic energy upon reaching the oppositely charged plate?

choices.label: Neither particle; both kinetic energies are the same.
It cannot be determined without knowing the value of the potential difference between the plates.
It cannot be determined without knowing the amount of charge on the plates.

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
